source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a wide scenery shot from a worm's-eye view, positioned at the bottom of a multi-story, rectangular stairwell looking directly up. There are no main subjects, as the focus is on the architectural space. The central opening of the stairwell recedes into the background at the top center of the frame, creating a sense of depth. The railings and landings of the lowest floor are in the foreground, framing the bottom and sides of the shot, while the structures of the floors above form layered, progressively smaller rectangles in the middle ground. The camera slowly rotates counter-clockwise, causing the entire geometric structure to tilt and appear to spiral within the frame, dynamically shifting the composition's diagonal lines.
